newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Early Taiwan dollar inches up on tight liquidity.
newsitem.headline: Early Taiwan dollar inches up on tight liquidity.

text.p: The Taiwan dollar edged slightly higher in early Wednesday trade, as investors sought to profit from the banking system's liquidity squeeze, dealers said.
After 45 minutes, or 0145 GMT, the local unit was at T$27.874 against Tuesday's T$27.885 finish.
Turnover through dealers was US$22 million.
"Many investors are selling U.S. dollars in exchange for Taiwan dollars following the surges in overnight interbank rate," said a dealer at a foreign bank.
"The overnight interbank rate is much more attractive now," the dealer said.

Taiwan's interbank rate roared briefly above nine percent and closed at a 21-month peak on Tuesday despite central bank stabilisation efforts, as a frantic stock market siphoned funds from the banking system.
With routine quarter-end greenback demand coming to an end, dealers said they saw more room for the Taiwan dollar to rise.
A range of T$27.85-90 was seen for Wednesday.
